info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:51AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Very Warm and Extremely Humid Today... An extremely moist air mass was present across the region and this air mass will remain in place today. Meanwhile, temperatures will climb into the lower 90s across the Piedmont and into the upper 80s west of the Blue Ridge. Dewpoint temperatures, a measure of the amount of moisture in the atmosphere, are unusually high for this region, being in the mid to upper 70s across much of the area this morning. These high dewpoint values will combine with the warm temperatures in the upper 80s to lower 90s to result in afternoon Heat Index Values or Apparent Temperature Values from 95 to 104. While this remains below Heat Advisory Criteria, it is nonetheless very warm, very uncomfortable, and can result in heat-related issues if proper precautions are not taken. Extensive exertion or strenuous activities in such hot conditions can lead to heat-related illness and problems. Young children and the elderly are particularly susceptible to heat related health issues. If you are planning to spend several hours out in the heat this afternoon, drink plenty of water, try to take breaks in an air conditioned facility, and reduce time outdoors as much as possible until later in the evening.
